item.title: Wuchang Fallen Feathers: Lightzen Temple 100% Walkthrough & Collectibles
item.description:
In Wuchang: Fallen Feathers, the game's opening region – Worship's Rise – is made up of several smaller subsections. The first two of these areas are called Reverent Temple and Buddha Cliffs , which act as a tutorial hub, and the first taste of exploration respectively. The third area is centered around Lightzen Temple, the first major location outside the opening area, and the subject of this guide.

Our coverage of Lightzen Temple will include, aside from the important locations within the temple grounds itself, the open areas surrounding the temple that Wuchang can explore. This will include Narrow Stretch, which is the path that leads from Lightzen Temple to the next major area, Shu Sanctum. All together, this guide will provide a c omplete walkthrough of Wuchang 's Lightzen Temple , and a complete l ist of all collectibles and NPCs in the area.

Lightzen Temple Complete Walkthrough Part 1 – Wuchang: Fallen Feathers

How to Reach Lightzen Temple:

Lightzen Temple is the first major location you'll encounter once you leave the Reverent Temple and begin to explore. Before reaching the temple, you'll have to pass through the Buddha Cliffs area, which is where the game's second shrine is located. After making your way through the caves, you'll come to a cliff section where you can look out and see Shu Sanctum, and the village that surrounds it. Lightzen Temple is at the bottom of this hill.

After descending into the valley from the cliff top, you'll know you're about to reach Lightzen Temple when you see the above gate.

Entering Lightzen Temple:

After you cross through the gate into Lightzen Temple, you'll see an item marker on the ground. This contains Fire Pot x3. Make sure to pick up the Fire Pots, as they will be useful right away. Actually, as soon as you pick up the pots, a tutorial window will appear on the right side of the screen that explains Special Items. These are items that are used to overcome combat situations that would otherwise be far more difficult.

In this case, if you continue up the stairs and look to the right, you'll see a group of enemies sitting among several explosive pots. If you throw a Fire Pot while locked-on to one of the enemies, the resulting chain reaction will cause the entire group to be killed.

Collect Darkfrost Edge – One-Handed Sword:

After the small group of enemies has been dealt with, you'll see a yellow item marker on a table behind the remains of the enemies. Head over and collect this item, which is revealed to be Wuchang: Fallen Feather 's first one-handed sword, Darkfrost Edge.

Lightzen Temple Building 1:

After destroying the group of enemies and collecting Darkfrost Edge, you'll notice there are three nearby buildings. The first building we'll call Building 1. The entrance to this building is found near the sitting enemies. After the explosion, a single spear-wielding enemy will emerge from this building. Deal with them, then enter the small shack.

Inside Building 1, you'll find a blue item marker sitting on a table. The contents are Steamed Bunny Bun x3.

Lightzen Temple Building 2:

Now, if you make a left at the top of the stairs that lead into the temple grounds, you'll see the entrances to Building 2. If you enter through the first entrance, which is on the left, you'll see a blue item marker inside on the ground. There are no enemies at this entrance, but be careful, as there are two small enemies hiding in the rafters of the other section of the building.

If you enter through Entrance 2, you'll see a yellow item marker on the ground, but you'll be ambushed by the two enemies in the rafters if you try to grab it. If you use a spell, or item like Flying Daggers, you can lure them down and take them out before collecting the items. The yellow item marker is the Monkey Pendant, which increases the power of throwables.

Items inside Building 2:

  • Blue Item Marker: Red Mercury Shoot x1
  • Yellow item Marker: Monkey Pendant

Locate the Lightzen Temple Shrine:

After clearing out the loot from the first group of buildings, you can then head to the Lightsen Temple Shrine. You can visit the shrine before looting if you are in need of refilling the Manna Vase.

After coming up the stairs that lead into the temple grounds, head straight past the group of sitting enemies, then cross the small courtyard. You'll find the Lightzen Temple Shrine sitting directly in front of the large temple building.

If you look at the stairs that lead up to the temple to the right of the shrine, you'll see a crow perched on one of the stone statues. If you kill the crow with a spell or throwing weapon, you'll receive Aurum Feather x1.

If you wish to head straight to the first major boss, continue up the stairs from the shrine, through the courtyard, and through the gate beyond the next structure. We'll cover this later, after completing the list of remaining loot.

Lightzen Temple Walkthrough Part 2 – Wuchang: Fallen Feathers

Should You Help Wu Gang?

To the left of the Lightzen Temple Shrine, you'll see a small NPC writhing on the ground in pain. If you interact with the NPC, a prompt will appear that gives you the option to ' Help him up' or ' Leave him be .' If you leave him be, he'll continue to roll on the ground. If you help him up, you'll begin Wu Gang's NPC questline . There is no reason not to help him up. Eventually, you'll be required to bring him items like Wuchang 's Golden Bowl.

Lightzen Temple Building 3:

After helping Wu Gang, turn left to find the third building in the Lightzen Temple compound. Inside, you'll find a dangerous potted-type enemy. These are the enemies that spit green acid, and reward Wuchang with the following items when killed:

  • Faint Red Feather
  • Red Murcury Sprout x1
  • Emerald Lotus Seed x1
  • Plumed Branch x1

There is also a basic blue item marker that contains Fire Lotus Seeds x3.

Lightzen Temple Building 4:

If you turn around from the shine you'll see a path that leads down to a locked gate , and Building 4. Walk down the path, and you'll encounter two enemies standing outside Building 4. Defeat the enemies, then look for a Blue Item Marker on the ground near a table covered in broken jars. The item is a Dough Figurine of Mu Guiying.

As you enter Building 4, watch out for the enemy hiding to the left of the entrance. Inside, you'll find a Purple Item Marker that contains a Faint Red Feather. It's very dark inside the building, but the item marker is fairly easy to see.

If you head to the gate at the end of the path, you'll realize it's locked, and you'll need the Lightzen Key to open it. If you turn left at the gate, you'll find a Health Pill hidden among the various items.

Lightzen Temple Courtyard:

Now that you've collected everything in the outer temple grounds, return to the shrine and make your way up the stairs and through the concrete tunnel. You'll emerge into a large courtyard with a building on each side. You'll see a crouching enemy in the center of the courtyard, with a blue item marker on the ground. Be careful as you approach, as there will be another enemy to the right, and it will attack you from behind.

The item on the ground is a Red Mercury Shoot x1. Pick it up, then head to the building on the right with the glowing treasure chest. Inside the chest, you'll find Lost Remains, which will allow you to increase the Manna Vase's potency at the shrine. As you exit the building, an enemy will emerge from the darkness and attack.

Now, head into the building on the left. Be careful, as two enemies will quickly attack you as you enter. Once they are clear, head inside and grab the Lantern Fruit x1 sitting on the bed. Once that is collected, you're ready to move on.

Now, you'll want to head around to the back side of the large structure that is directly across from the tunnel that you used to enter the courtyard. Inside the small chamber, you'll find the Golden Bowl. Pick it up, and give it to Wu Gang when you next encounter him at Shu Sanctum.

Exit the small chamber, and proceed through the gate. Here, you'll face the first major boss of the game: Master Raider – Man-eating Dhutanga. Luckily, this foe is one of the easier bosses. He is incredibly susceptible to Charged Heavy Attacks with the Longsword. Make use of this tactic, and you'll defeat him in no time.

Defeating Dhutanga will unlock Wuchang 's Tempering mechanic . It will also earn you the following items :

  • Copper Jug (Turn in to merchant at Shu Sanctum)
  • Lightzen Key
  • Echo of Dhutanga (Spell)

Narrow Stretch Walkthrough – Wuchang:Fallen Feathers

Exit Lightzen Temple:

After defeating the boss, return to the gate that required the Lightzen Key. Make sure to kill the Aurum Feather crow perched above the gate. After exiting the gate, follow the path until it reaches a T, then turn right. As you follow the path, you'll see a small green and yellow creature popping up from the ground. If you kill it before it buries itself at the end of the path, you'll receive Bamboo Shoot x1, which you can use to trade with the Panda near the Shu Sanctum.

If you miss the bamboo creature, return to the shrine and enter the dream to get another chance.

There is nothing back the opposite way, so continue along the main path after killing the bamboo creature. When you reach the rock bridge, look down to the right, and you'll see an item on a large rock. Pick up the Budding Red Mercury x1, then cross the bridge and make your way up the hill.

At the top of the hill, you'll encounter an NPC resting against a tree. This is Nian Suichang. When prompted, ask him for News From Nearby. At the next prompt, Agree to Help. Nian will teach you the Well Met gesture, and give you the Bone Whistle, which will allow you to call him when you need help in battle. He will then move to Shu Sanctum, which is found further up the hill. This essentially marks the end of the short Narrow Stretch section, and the start of the area surrounding Shu Sanctum.

8 Images
8 Images
Wuchang: Fallen Feathers
8 /10
8.5 /10

item.title: This Anime Action RPG Might Be the Sleeper Hit of the Year
item.description:
Action game fans have been eating good in recent years, and with Lost Soul Aside set to launch in just a few short weeks, it looks like that will continue to be the case. The Chinese-developed character-action game is shaping up to be a flashy, vibrant, and hard-hitting combat sandbox, perfectly suited to fans of franchises like Devil May Cry and the old-school God of War saga.

Lost Soul Aside is just the next of many high-profile, ambitious modern action games coming out of China, with other recent examples including Wuchang: Fallen Feathers and Black Myth Wukong .

Lost Soul Aside is part of Sony's China Hero Project, an initiative formed to support and promote Chinese developers. This is part of what makes the game so exciting: there's a real sense that Lost Soul Aside could have an X-factor, as it's coming from a new, unproven studio. In fact, it initially began as a one-man operation, helmed by game director Yang Bing, who now oversees a team of developers. All of this is to say that Lost Soul Aside has a lot of potential, and looks great so far, so it could very well morph into a breakout hit when it releases in late August of this year.

Why Players Should Keep an Eye On Lost Soul Aside

Lost Soul Aside Looks Like a Dyed-in-the-Wool Character-Action Game

The character-action genre is defined by seminal franchises like Devil May Cry and Bayonetta , though it's also seen some great one-off releases, such as Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance and Lollipop Chainsaw . This is to say that, while the CAG space is dominated by popular IP, the genre's fundamentals are flexible enough to work with a number of different projects, all of which can toy around with its central tenets in interesting or unexpected ways. In theory, this should translate to a busy, highly competitive CAG space, but that's not really the case.

Character-action games are surprisingly few and far between, with developers ostensibly eschewing the genre's fast, fluid, and stylish combat fundamentals in favor of slower, more methodical mechanics, like those of the soulslike genre. Make no mistake, there's no single "right" way to make an action game, but the dearth of proper character-action experiences is certainly disappointing. This is why Lost Soul Aside has the chance to make a grand entrance, winning audiences over with its execution of the genre's flashy, intuitive, complex mechanics. It's too early to say whether this execution will actually be solid—remember, this is developer Ultizero Games' debut—but the future looks promising.

Lost Soul Aside Has Promise—Hopefully, It Will Be Realized

Lost Soul Aside certainly looks the part: available gameplay footage paints a picture of an action game that knows exactly what it wants to be. Players have control over a slew of different weapons, combos, and special abilities, and can dance around the battlefield amidst a flurry of blows and magical strikes. The combination of an ever-expanding moves list and what appears to be a version of Bayonetta 's Witch Time dodge mechanic could make Lost Soul Aside 's gameplay appropriately dynamic, expressive, and robust.

There's not much to say about the story, though: Lost Soul Aside 's narrative comes across like a fairly standard "save the world" plot. Granted, the character-action genre isn't exactly known for subtle or sophisticated writing, but it is known for its charm. Characters like Bayonetta and Dante are dripping with charisma, as are the worlds that they inhabit. Right now, it looks like Lost Soul Aside 's greatest hurdle could be nailing this sense of identity and allure. Hopefully, Ultizero sticks the landing on this front as well as the gameplay one.

item.title: Fortnite's Borderlands Collab Makes a Strong Case for a BL4 DLC Vault Hunter
item.description:
One of the most appealing aspects of Fortnite is its crossovers with many well-known properties. Skins based on popular movies, TV shows, and video game series are all represented in Fortnite , resulting in gaming’s most eclectic cast of playable characters ever. As chaotic as the game’s current collabs can be, there are always more opportunities for skins to surprise players.

Like with many other video game franchises, the Borderlands series already has some representation in Fortnite with the Psycho Bandit skin. This might not be the end of this crossover, however. A leak has revealed another Borderlands character could make their playable debut in Fortnite very soon - Mad Moxxi - and this could be the perfect setup for her addition as a DLC Vault Hunter in Borderlands 4 .

Moxxi Could Be a DLC Vault Hunter Contender Thanks to Fortnite

Mad Moxxi Fortnite Skin Leak

Trustworthy leakers iFireMonkey and Shiina revealed that Borderlands ’ Mad Moxxi will be added to the Fortnite Item Shop, making her playable for the first time. This wouldn’t be the first time that Fortnite has beaten a video game series to the punch by making an NPC playable, such as with the Exo-Stranger skin representing Destiny and Cyberpunk 2077 ’s Johnny Silverhand. Adding Moxxi as a playable skin is a great incentive for Borderlands fans, and could test the waters for her playable status in the series’ future.

All leaks should be taken with a pinch of salt, but this one does have some credibility to it. As well as the leakers being reliable sources, the long-awaited return of the Borderlands Psycho Bandit skin in Fortnite makes the leak much more likely. The skin didn’t appear in the Item Shop for almost five years, finally returning on April 29, 2025. Since then, the Psycho Bandit skin has made frequent appearances in the Item Shop.

The Psycho Bandit Fortnite Skin first appeared in the Item Shop on August 27, 2019.

Considering how often the Borderlands collab keeps appearing in Fortnite recently, it wouldn’t be out of the question for more skins to be available as part of this crossover soon. As one of Borderlands ’ best characters, Moxxi would be a great addition to Fortnite and the perfect choice to promote the upcoming Borderlands 4 .

Playable Moxxi in Fortnite Could Set Her Up for BL4

Despite appearing in every mainline game in the series and receiving three Borderlands DLC campaigns based around her, Moxxi still hasn’t been playable in any of the games. She is a crucial part of the franchise’s identity, and while her playable status in Fortnite is likely to be very rewarding for fans of the Borderlands series, the best way to honor Moxxi’s legacy could be to include her as a playable Vault Hunter.

Borderlands 4 has already established its main cast of playable characters, but there are always opportunities for more. It has already been confirmed that Borderlands 4 will have DLC Vault Hunters, but who these are specifically remains a mystery for now. It’s possible that these could be completely original characters making their series debut in Borderlands 4 , but there’s always the chance that an NPC from the series’ past could take on a playable role as DLC. Since Moxxi is a fan-favorite character, it could be the best decision to upgrade her to a playable status.

Throughout the Borderlands series, players learn more about Moxxi’s past, with one of her traits being that she is skilled in combat. However, this aspect of the character is rarely seen in-game. Her potential addition to Fortnite finally gives Moxxi a more active combative role, but Borderlands 4 could take this further. By making Moxxi one of Borderlands 4 ’s DLC Vault Hunters, the violent side of the character can finally be brought forward, showing players a version of her that they have yet to see throughout the series.

More Fortnite Borderlands Skins Could Be Added

With the hints that Moxxi will be added to Fortnite , it wouldn’t be unlikely for more Borderlands characters to be included too. The series has many iconic characters to choose from, but very few are as memorable as Borderlands ’ previous Vault Hunters. After playing as these characters throughout the games, it is easy for players to grow fond of them and their individual personalities. If Fortnite is looking to make its collab with Borderlands even more appealing to fans, adding characters like Lilith and Zane could be worthwhile.

This could also be used as an opportunity to promote Borderlands 4 ’s existing Vault Hunters. Each of the game’s playable characters could be added to Fortnite prior to the release of Borderlands 4 , getting players used to the cast before committing to one choice in BL4 . Though the Borderlands skins in Fortnite won’t have anywhere near as many abilities as they do in Borderlands 4 , it could still be an incentive for players to use the new characters early.

As Moxxi’s possible Fortnite inclusion would make her playable for the first time, other Borderlands NPCs could get the same treatment. Handsome Jack is easily Borderlands ’ best villain, and is arguably one of the best in all of gaming. Though his doppelganger was one of the Vault Hunters in The Pre-Sequel , Handsome Jack himself was not playable. While it is very unlikely that he will return to the Borderlands series, a skin in Fortnite is not out of the question, and could be the best way to let players play as the "real" version of the iconic villain.

Borderlands collaborating with Fortnite again is great for fans of both games, but the potential addition of Moxxi as a Fortnite skin could be hinting at something more. Giving Moxxi a playable role feels as though it could be leading up to her being on of Borderlands 4 DLC Vault Hunters. Her appearance in Fortnite may be enough for some fans, but giving the character her own abilities and skill trees in Borderlands 4 is something that the battle royale cannot match. Until the DLC Vault Hunters are revealed, though, players can enjoy the Psycho Bandit skin in Fortnite , and may possibly be able to look forward to the arrival of Moxxi soon.

item.title: New Friday the 13th Game Might Not Be What You Expect
item.description:
After 16 years of relative obscurity following the release of the 2009 Friday the 13th remake, the Friday the 13th franchise is back in full swing with multiple upcoming film, TV, and game projects. For one, production on the A24 Friday the 13th prequel series, Crystal Lake , is in full production and set to finish filming this fall and expected to debut in 2026. At 2025’s San Diego Comic Con Jason Universe panel, Horror, Inc. announced that Jason Voorhees will officially return to the silver screen this August through the 13-minute-long short-form vignette Sweet Revenge . On top of Sweet Revenge , Horror Inc. Executive Vice President Robbie Barsamian announced that a new sequel Friday the 13th film and game are in development. However, the new game may not be what fans expect.

Everything Known About Friday the 13th’s New Film and Game

After showing a trailer for Sweet Revenge and announcing that the vignette would debut on August 13th, the Jason Universe panel concluded with Barsamian announcing that a new Friday the 13th sequel film and game are in the works. Specifically, Barsamian stated, “I can tell you that a new sequel movie and new sequel game are at the top of our list. It’s where most of our energy’s going right now. And I can tell you finally we’re in a position to deliver on that.” Barsamian told attendees that Horror Inc. wasn’t prepared yet to publicly unveil who they’re working with to produce both the film and game, but he assured fans that both the Friday the 13th film and game are coming.

It’s currently unknown if the new Friday the 13th movie and game will build on story beats established in the Crystal Lake show or in Sweet Revenge , which is directed by Mike P. Nelson, who previously directed 2021’s Wrong Turn reboot and directed the upcoming 2025 Silent Night, Deadly Night reboot. While Barsamian did call the upcoming Friday the 13th movie and game sequels, it’s currently unknown if the film will be a sequel to Friday the 13th ’s original 11 films or be a sequel to the 2009 Platinum Dunes Friday the 13th remake. It’s additionally unknown if the sequel Friday the 13th game will be a sequel to IllFonic’s recently discontinued 2017 Friday the 13th: The Game .- though it would arguably make more sense for the new game to be tied to the upcoming film as opposed to being a direct successor to IllFonic's project.

The Potential Direction and Gameplay of the New Friday the 13th Game

Friday the 13th has never truly had a perfect horror game of its own. Several companies have attempted to adapt Friday the 13th in video game form before, with Domark’s 1986 Friday the 13th: The Computer Game , Atlus’s 1989 Friday the 13th , and Blue Wizard Digital’s 2018 Friday the 13th: Killer Puzzle . However, none of these games were able to capture the horrifying appeal of Jason Voorhees’ Camp Crystal Lake kills as the films did. 2017’s Friday the 13th: The Game came close to being a great Friday the 13th game with its perfect recreation of multiple Jason outfits and film sets, but it was restricted by its online reliance and lack of updates due to then ongoing legal battles with the Friday the 13th IP.

With horror films and games becoming increasingly mainstream, it would seem that Horror Inc. is at an opportune moment to debut both a Friday the 13th film and a game. However, it would make sense for the game to be closely tied to the film for synergy and to help better establish the new Jason Universe instead of making fans potentially confused by featuring elements from Friday the 13th ’s two other timelines. This may depend on what structure Horror Inc. is going for with the Friday the 13th game, as a narrative-driven, single-player survival horror game may be better connected solely to the new film. Meanwhile, a new Friday the 13th multiplayer game could potentially incorporate elements from all Jason media similar to Friday the 13th: The Game , even if it's not a proper sequel. Right now, it's anyone's guess what the game will look like, but there are reasons to believe it will be a bit different from what fans have already seen.

The Potential Story of the New Friday the 13th Game

If the new Friday the 13th film and game are tied to one another, the game could potentially connect the film to the Crystal Lake series or simply depict one fateful Friday the 13th off-screen. For example, the Crystal Lake series appears to be depicting Jason Voorhees’ initial “death” and subsequent murder spree by his mom, Pamela Voorhees, from the first Friday the 13th movie. If the new Friday the 13th film is essentially a remake of Friday the 13th Part 2 and 3 , the Friday the 13th game could depict a younger Jason struggling to survive alone near Crystal Lake and killing off nearby residents, hunters, and campers. This way, Jason would be playable and feature a story that wouldn’t conflict with the series or the new film.

Friday The 13th: Ultimate Slasher
Action

item.title: How to Get the Free Blitz Wings Back Bling in Fortnite
item.description:
Fortnite patch v36.30 focused heavily on the Blitz game mode, which has been a success among the community since its release in June 2025. This recent updated added new playlists to the Blitz game mode. To incentivize players to try out these additions, Epic Games is giving away the Blitz Wings back bling as a freeby, but there is a requirement that they must meet first.

This guide tells players how they can get the Blitz Wings back bling in Fortnite for free. This is a limited-time offer, so gamers who want to acquire this item will have to act fast.

How to Get the Free Blitz Wings Back Bling in Fortnite

Unfortunately, the Blitz Axe pickaxe is no longer available for free, but Blitz mode has a new offer for its players: a brand-new free back bling. For the next few days, players can unlock the Blitz Wings for free in Fortnite , and they can either do it in Blitz mode or any other game mode.

The Blitz Wings are a Bonus Goal reward for completing Blitz Founders Quests in Fortnite . To get the Blitz Wings for free, players have to finish one Blitz Founders Quest before the offer expires on August 12 . There are two Blitz Founders Quests:

  • Win Blitz Royale matches (5)
  • Earn account levels in any Fortnite experience (5)

The first quest is exclusive to Blitz mode, but the second one allows players to level up by playing any experience that they would like. Winning a Blitz match is undoubtely much harder than leveling up. Additionally, by the time players win their fifth matches, they will have most likely leveled up five times. Either way, as soon as players complete one quest, they will be given the Blitz Wings as a reward at the end of the match .
